name: ethyl 5-hydroxy-2-methyl-3-oxo-6-(2,2,3-trimethylcyclopent-3-en-1-yl)hexanoate
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1951
Reason: 5-hydroxy-2-methyl-3-oxo-6-(2,2,3-trimethylcyclopent-3-en-1-yl)hexanoate has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is hexanoic acid, which has a melting point of -10.5°C. The functional groups and structural features in ethyl 5-hydroxy-2-methyl-3-oxo-6-(2,2,3-trimethylcyclopent-3-en-1-yl)hexanoate will affect its melting point: (1) The methyl group introduces a rigid structure, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and increase the melting point by approximately +5°C. (2) The hydroxyl group introduces a polar functional group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and increase the melting point by approximately +10°C. (3) The trimethylcyclopent-3-en-1-yl group introduces a bulky structure, which can increase the melting point due to steric hindrance and rigidity, estimated at around +20°C. (4) The oxo group introduces a carbonyl functional group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and increase the melting point by approximately +30°C. Summing these modifications gives us an estimated melting point shift.
